item.title: J.R. add a quote by Goethe Johann-Wolfga
item.description: "Combine truth and invention for the sake of a closer approach to reality" -- Goethe Johann-Wolfga

item.title: J.R. add a quote by Charles Nodier
item.description: "A writer should read until he is filled to the brim and like a pitcher which is over-filled over flows. And then he should write." -- Charles Nodier

item.title: J.R. add a quote by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
item.description: "Diligence is the mother of good fortune." -- Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

item.title: J.R. add a quote by Ed Lynskey
item.description: "I cadged a complimentary green matchbook with a gold bird icon from the Bell canning jar. Later we'd use the matches to light our spliffs. My fingertips tapped the stem to the gizmo that dinged a bell. Nobody came out. Wrong signal, so I did two bell rings. No response prompted me to tap out a series of bell rings." -- Ed Lynskey

item.title: J.R. add a quote by Richard Wheeler
item.description: "The person who would like to make his dreams come true must stay awake." -- Richard Wheeler
